_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 16:50:52 using v2.1
title: How have waiting times after an urgent referral changed by cancer type?
analysis_commentary:
The proportion of people having an outpatient appointment within two weeks varied slightly by cancer type, but remained above 93.0% for all cancer types in both quarters. The highest rates were seen for testicular cancer, lung cancer and haematological malignancies. The lowest rate in both quarters was seen for upper gastrointestinal cancer.

Please note that some of these cancers are very rare (data not shown) and changes in a small number of cases can have a large effect on the proportions.
